# Autopilot
The [color=#a4885c]autopilot system[/color] allows your shuttle to automatically navigate to a target destination without manual piloting. This feature is particularly useful for long-distance travel across the sector.
## Requirements To use the autopilot system, your shuttle must have an [color=#a4885c]autopilot server[/color] installed. This is a machine that can be researched and constructed through the Engineering research tree.
## Using Autopilot
To engage the autopilot:
1. Open the [color=#a4885c]shuttle console[/color] in your cockpit. 2. Select a target destination on the radar (such as a POI, station, or another ship). 3. Click the [color=#a4885c]"Enable Autopilot"[/color] button at the top of the console right click menu.
Once engaged, the autopilot will: - Automatically calculate the flight path to your target - Navigate around obstacles - Maintain safe velocity during travel (60% of max speed) - Slow down as it approaches the destination
## Disengaging Autopilot The autopilot will automatically disengage when: - You manually pilot the shuttle (press any movement or rotation keys) - You click the [color=#a4885c]"Disable Autopilot"[/color] button - The shuttle reaches its destination
## Safety Notes - The autopilot cannot dock for you - you must manually dock when you reach your destination - Always monitor your shuttle while autopilot is active - The autopilot may not react to sudden threats or changes in the environment - Announce your intended route over the traffic channel ([color=#CC6633]:d[/color]) before engaging autopilot for long journeys
